com.ibm.team.workitem.client

Interface IWorkItemWorkingCopyManager


  • public interface IWorkItemWorkingCopyManager
    A work item working copy manager allows to connect and disconnect from work item working copies and provides other working copy related operations. Working copies are shared within the system.

    Every connect must be balanced by an eventual disconnect when the working copy is no longer used. A typical usage pattern is: 

            manager.connect(...);
        try {
                WorkItemWorkingCopy workingCopy= manager.getWorkingCopy(...);
                ...change and save working copy...
        } finally {
                manager.disconnect(...);
        }
    The connect methods ensure that no connection is established if they throw an exception. See WorkItemOperation which implements this pattern for convenience.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    WorkItemWorkingCopy, IWorkItemClient.getWorkItemWorkingCopyManager(), WorkItemOperation

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(IWorkItemHandle handle,
           ItemProfile<IWorkItem> profile,
           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Connects to the current working copy and upgrades it with the given profile or creates a new working copy if none exists. Clients must disconnect after they have stopped using that working copy.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to connect to
        profile - the requested item profile
        monitor - the progress monitor, can be null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if work item was deleted or anything goes wrong while accessing the repository
        See Also:
        disconnect(IWorkItemHandle), getWorkingCopy(IWorkItemHandle)

      • connect

        void connect(java.util.List<? extends IWorkItemHandle> handles,
           ItemProfile<IWorkItem> profile,
           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        See Also:
        connect(IWorkItemHandle, ItemProfile, IProgressMonitor)

      • connectCurrent

        void connectCurrent(IWorkItemHandle handle,
                  ItemProfile profile,
                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Connects to the current working copy and upgrades it with the given profile or creates a new working copy from the item's current state in the repository if none exists. Clients must disconnect after they have stopped using that working copy.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to connect to
        profile - the requested item profile
        monitor - the progress monitor, can be null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if work item was deleted or anything goes wrong while accessing the repository
        See Also:
        disconnect(IWorkItemHandle), getWorkingCopy(IWorkItemHandle)

      • connectNew

        IWorkItemHandle connectNew(IWorkItemType workItemType,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException

        Connects to a new working copy for a new item. Clients must disconnect after they have stopped using that working copy. Not applicable to read-only manager.

        Parameters:
        workItemType - the requested work item type
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if work item was deleted or anything goes wrong while accessing the repository
        See Also:
        disconnect(IWorkItemHandle), getWorkingCopy(IWorkItemHandle), IWorkItemCommon.findWorkItemType(com.ibm.team.process.common.IProjectAreaHandle, String, IProgressMonitor)

      • connectLocal

        boolean connectLocal(IWorkItemHandle handle,
                   ItemProfile<IWorkItem> profile)
        Connects to the current working copy with the given profile, does not create a new working copy if none exists and does not connect if the existing working copy has a smaller profile. Clients must disconnect after they have stopped using that working copy.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to connect to
        profile - the requested item profile
        Returns:
        true iff an existing working copy has been connected to
        See Also:
        disconnect(IWorkItemHandle), getWorkingCopy(IWorkItemHandle)

      • save

        IDetailedStatus save(WorkItemWorkingCopy[] copies,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException,
                            MultiStaleDataException
        Saves n working copies. The save is done in a transaction meaning either all items are saved or none. Not applicable to read-only manager.
        Parameters:
        copies - the work item working copies to save
        monitor - the progress monitor to report progress or null if no progress reporting is desired
        Throws:
        MultiStaleDataException - if one of the working copies to be saved is stale (e.g. there is a new instance on the server)
        TeamRepositoryException - if another problem occurs during save
        See Also:
        WorkItemWorkingCopy.save(IProgressMonitor)

      • delete

        java.util.List<IDetailedStatus> delete(java.util.List<IWorkItemHandle> handles,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deletes n work items from the repository. The delete is done as a best-effort operation meaning that it tries to delete as many items as possible. Not applicable to read-only manager.
        Parameters:
        handles - the work item handles to delete
        monitor - the progress monitor to report progress or null if no progress reporting is desired
        Returns:
        status indicating whether the operation where performed properly. May provide IOperationReport to give for details about problems that occurred, e.g., if authenticated contributor is not authorized to delete work items from the repository.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if an unexpected problem prevents deletion entirely

      • getWorkingCopy

        WorkItemWorkingCopy getWorkingCopy(IWorkItemHandle handle)
        Returns the working copy corresponding to the given handle. The working copy must have been connected to before.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to return the working copy for
        Returns:
        the working copy or null if the underlying work item was deleted
        See Also:
        connect(IWorkItemHandle, ItemProfile, IProgressMonitor)

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(IWorkItemHandle handle)
        Disconnects from the working copy corresponding to the given handle. The working copy must have been connected to before and may no longer be accessed afterwards.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to disconnect from

      • revert

        void revert(IWorkItemHandle handle)
        Reverts the work item of the working copy corresponding to the given handle to its item working copy predecessor state. The working copy must have been connected to before.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to revert

      • refresh

        void refresh(IWorkItemHandle handle)
        Refreshes the working copy corresponding to the given handle with the current state in item manager. The working copy must have been connected to before.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to revert

      • refreshWithCurrent

        void refreshWithCurrent(IWorkItemHandle handle,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Refreshes the working copy corresponding to the given handle with the current state in the repository. The working copy must have been connected to before.
        Parameters:
        handle - the handle of the item to revert
        monitor - the progress monitor, can be null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong while accessing the repository

      • refreshLinksForGlobalConfigurationChange

        void refreshLinksForGlobalConfigurationChange(IWorkItemHandle handle)
        Refreshes the global configuration map associated with the given handle with the current configuration from the repository.
        Parameters:
        handle -

      • applyLinksUpdate

        void applyLinksUpdate(IWorkItemHandle handle,
                    java.util.List<com.ibm.team.links.common.ILink> links)
        Updates an existing working copy for the given handle with the given links. The links must be all links persisted in the repository at the current time where the given handle corresponds to either the source or the target item reference.

        If the working copy's profile includes references, these will be updated without loosing pending changes. If the working copy's profile does not include references, it will be upgraded with the given links. If the working copy for the given handle does not exist, this call has no effect.

        Parameters:
        handle - the handle
        links - the links
